subtopic: NMR chemical shift and spin-spin coupling
function_phrase: Don’t get hung up on the numbers—
main_point: The professor explains NMR chemical shift and spin-spin coupling and how to interpret evidence when measurements can be misleading.
detail1: The professor distinguishes photolysis (a process) from enantiomer (a proxy/measurement).
detail2: He suggests testing an asymmetric prediction involving ligand and chemical shift.
attitude: Casual but analytical; he warns against over-trusting a neat correlation.
organization_point: He adds a tangent about an ethics aside to show real-world constraints.
connecting_point: The example about controlling for transition state shows how bias can flip an apparent pattern.
